Posts.Content: Iona, I didn't loose any hair during the first cycle, lost the most during round 2 then it slowed down. I am a bit worried that it is the Tamoxifen, I can tell by the grey roots that it's hair that's been around awhile, the short grey fluffy bits don't appear to be coming out. My eyebrows & lashes have thinned but still have enough there. Thank you
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Iona, I didn't loose any hair during the first cycle, lost the most during round 2 then it slowed down. I am a bit worried that it is the Tamoxifen, I can tell by the grey roots that it's hair that's been around awhile, the short grey fluffy bits don't appear to be coming out. My eyebrows & lashes have thinned but still have enough there. Thank you
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi, try Annabandana on line they are very reasonable. xx
Posts.Title: Any thoughts on the cap to avoid hair falling out?

Posts.Content: Hi Iona, just wondered how long your hair continued to shed once your chemo was over. I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide the last one was 22 Feb. I had kept 50/60% of my hair, but it is shedding 6 weeks later. Thank you
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi, I would say she should give it a go. They is to make sure it's fitted correctly, It's need to be touching all your scalp. I had 4 cycles of DC and kept around 60% of my hair. I lost the most after the 2nd cycle, I'm convinced it wasn't on right, it was the only time my hair wasn't covered in ice when it came off. It shed for a number of weeks after. My last chemo was end of Feb and my hair is now strangely ticker than before and growing really fast. Hope this helps. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Any thoughts on the cap to avoid hair falling out?

Posts.Content: Hi Iona, just wondered how long your hair continued to shed once your chemo was over. I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide the last one was 22 Feb. I had kept 50/60% of my hair, but it is shedding 6 weeks later. Thank you
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi, I hardly felt anything when my drains were removed, I was worried as they had been in there 10 days. xx
Posts.Title: Advice please-Mastectomy with lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi, I had 8mm invasive ductal, sentinel node was clear. My Oncotype score was 38 so chemo recommended. I wasn't expecting to have chemo so I was a bit disappointed. I had made my mind up that unless my score was low I would opt for chemo, as I wanted to do everything possible to reduce the risk of recurrence.  With a score of 38, risk of recurrence was 26% with just Tamoxifen, with chemo & Tamoxifen it reduced to 9% over 10 years. I didn't need radiotherapy. Xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Lovely to hear goods news xx
Posts.Title: The neoadjuvant chemo is working.

Posts.Content: Hi Funda, I how long after your chemo did your hair stop shedding. I had my last cycle of DC on 22/2, I'm still loosing some hair every day.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hi Funda the cold cap worked ok for me I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil + Cylophsphamide. I didn't loose any hair at all with the 1st cycle, lost the most the 2nd then it slowed down. I am slightly concerned as its 5 weeks since my last cycle and it's not slowing down. I started taking Tamoxifen a couple of weeks ago so keeping my fingers crossed it's not adding to the hair loss. xx
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Good news you're on the mend, you've been in my thoughts. xx
Posts.Title: THANKYOU SO MUCH

Posts.Content: Hi I used the paxman scalp cooling had 4 cycles of DC. I have probably still got 50/60% of my hair. Though last one was 22/2 & hair is still shedding slightly. For me the extra hour was worth it.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hi, I found it more uncomfortable than painful, I took a couple of paracetamol about an hour before and took some with me to take later if needed. The 4th session was the most uncomfortable as my hair had thinned, Within 5/10 mins of the cap coming off I was fine no headaches. If your hair thins you can cover the thinner parts with gauze or ask if you can have a surgeons cap, I should have done this on my last one. I had to take conditioner in, after the 1st session I used a children's one as it easier to wash out. You or the nurses spray your hair with water, then put the conditioner on. It makes it easier to take the cap off, as your hair may be covered with ice.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: I checked with my oncologist if it was safe, he said it was I also looked it up on the internet. As my hair has thinned some of the chemo must be getting to my scalp.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: signed, fingers crossed it works. xx
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Hi, I had surgery before chemo no sure why. I had 8mm G3 ductal SN clear. It could be because chemo was only recommend after Oncotype results came through.
Posts.Title: Advice on Axillary Lymph Nodes Dissection / Lymph Nodes Removal

Posts.Content: Hi have the said which chemo drugs and no of cycles you'll be having? I only had 4 cycles maybe you'll be the same. I was really nervous before chemo started, it rubbish at times but doable, if you decide to have it you'll get through it and come out the other side. Take care. xx
Posts.Title: Chemo - long term implications for treatment

Posts.Content: Hi, I had surgery first and wasn't expecting to need chemo as the biopsy results were a  large area of DCIS + a suspicion of a micro invasion. I had a mastectomy. The pathology reults after the surgery were 8mm G3 invasive + 8mm DCIS, S node clear, after the Onckotype test chemo was recommended. I had 4 cycles of DC, they gave me an anti sickness drug before the chemo, I never felt sick once, did have the tiredness/lack of energy which got worse each cycle. The horrible mouth lack of taste buds isn't very pleasant. Chemo is rubbish but it's doable, I live on my own, managed with help from family & friends. I got out for a short walk when I could, and made sure I had nice things planned for the 3rd week when I felt well. We are all different and most people don't get every side effect. It's 6 months since my last chemo I'm virtually back to normal, well my new normal. I used the scalp cooling so kept about 60% of my hair, it could be worth her giving it a go, it helped me not loosing my hair. I'm not sure how old your mum is, I was 60 a few weeks before being diagnosed. I would say just be there for her to support and help and you'll both get through and come out the other end. Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Scared about my mums chemo!

Posts.Content: Good news, enjoy your weekend xx
Posts.Title: So worried - 2 new lumps in my other breast

Posts.Content: Hi I had a right side mastectomy plus 1 sentinel node removed, also had an expander implant. Apart from my PJs I only wore front fastening clothes for a few days. I used dry shampoo for a few days and had my hair washed at the hairdressers a couple of times until the dressings came off and I could use the shower. I found it wasn't as bad as I thought also accepted help offered by friends, hoovering, taking me shopping. xx
Posts.Title: Pre-op nerves

Posts.Content: Hi try not to worry my hair continued shedding for around 8 weeks after my last chemo. New hair will be growing at the same time. Its just over 2 years since my last chemo and my hair is much thicker than it was before chemo and in good condition. xxx
Posts.Title: Hair still falling out 4 weeks after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, my ER score was 6, the BCN said it was still considered a high score. xx
Posts.Title: Er 6

Posts.Content: I didn't as him, but my BCN said it would. I'm taking Tamoxifen for 2 years, then changing to Letzrole for 3. Not easy I know but try not to worry, I suspect if they didn't think it would work well they wouldn't prescribe it.
Posts.Title: Er 6

Posts.Content: Hi, my ER score was 6, the BCN said it was still considered a high score. xx
Posts.Title: Er 6

Posts.Content: I didn't as him, but my BCN said it would. I'm taking Tamoxifen for 2 years, then changing to Letzrole for 3. Not easy I know but try not to worry, I suspect if they didn't think it would work well they wouldn't prescribe it.
Posts.Title: Er 6

Posts.Content: Hi, I've been on Tamoxifen for 9 months I've had virtually no side effects and I've lost just over a stone. I used the cold cap so didn't loose all my hair but it did thin on top. strangely it's growing back much thicker than it used to be.  Not everyone gets the side effects, I was quite worried as I thought it might not be working. My BCN said the majority of ladies have virtually no SE. You only really hear from those who unfortunately do. I get mine from Boots and the very helpful pharmacist gets me TEVA each time, also I take it at night. I would give it ago and see what happens. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: Hi I had a mastectomy on 31/10 for 8mm grade 3, lymph node clear. My Oncotype result took 4 weeks, the score was 38 which meant chemo recommended. I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil and Cylophsphamide, no radiotherapy. Now on Tamoxifen.
Posts.Title: THE WAITING !!!

Posts.Content: Hi over 31 is considered high, even though mine was 38 and chemo was recommended, they did say the choice was mine. I was given a copy of the results.Hormone therapy alone 26% risk of reacurance over 10 years, having chemo reduced the risk of reacurance to 9%. Chemo is not pleasant but I my thoughts were better safe than sorry. Hope this helps
Posts.Title: THE WAITING !!!

Posts.Content: Hi, mine was grade 3 8mm, Oncotype score was 38 so chemo was definitely recommended. I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide, chemo is not easy but it's doable. I fortunately escaped most of the more unpleasant side effects and 4 months on I'm nearly back to normal. I'm 60, fit and healthy, I decided to take what ever they offered to hopefully prevent recurrence. Taking Tamoxifen for 2 years, followed by Letrozole for at least years, also having 6 monthly infusions of Zoledronic Acid. I didn't need any radiotherapy. Everyone is different, you have to do what's best for you, I was glad the decision was easy for me as I'm not good a making decisions. Take care xx
Posts.Title: oncoDX result

Posts.Content: Hi, I the only time I noticed any of the blue dye was the first time I went to the loo after the surgery.  xx
Posts.Title: Tell me about your scars

Posts.Content: Hi I'm those had the 1st one with my last chemo in Feb. I'm not having injections though, will be via IV infusion which takes about 20 mins. My next one is 22/8. I'm not sure how long for, I'll ask my oncologist next time I see him.  I think most of the bad side effects are rare, I've not noticed any. I decided to take anything offered to prevent recurrence. There has been mention mention of the treatment in the group, I believe there was something on the BBC last year. Hope this helps, take care.
Posts.Title: biphosphonates

Posts.Content: Hi, I didn't have FEC, had DC, I have seen somewhere recently could have been on a Brest cancer care thread that some oncologists are dropping the F because of the side effects. It also said that the EC or EC+T are no less effective. Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Fec

Posts.Content: Hi, I think you can get the YES moisturiser on the NHS. xx
Posts.Title: Letrazole side effect

Posts.Content: Hi I had something similar about 3 weeks after surgery one area went bight red. It turned out to be a low grade infection cleared up in a few days with antibiotics. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Reddening of breast 4 weeks after op.

Posts.Content: Hi, tastebuds do come back after chemo, I found sucking ice lollies good for the dry mouth. I lost about 10lb during chemo. Take care
Posts.Title: Chemo Starts Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi have you packed your conditioner, you'll need to dampen your hair then put conditioner on, the nurses might do it, they did mine. I forgot my headband one time, the nurses lent me one.  How long the cold cap stays on depends on the chemo drugs. I had Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide, I always had the Cylophsphamide 1st, that meant it only had to stay on 45 mins after the Doxetacil. I was usually there just over 3 & 1/2 hours. Good luck for tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Chemo Starts Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm having bio phosphates every 6 months I've had 4 to more to go. It's to reduce the risk of of bone secondaries, I've not had any side effects. I'm on Tamoxifen. xx
Posts.Title: Pathology reports and consulant letters

Posts.Content: Hi, I didn't have FEC so can't compare I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide, I had very few side effects, tiredness/lack of energy and the horrible mouth weird taste not much else. I did talk to a few people before I started who'd had FEC & T apart from 1 they all found FEC harder think it could have been the nausea. It nearly 5 months since my last chemo, I don't appear to have any lasting side effects. My Oncologist went through all the possible SEs before I started, he did say that most people will only get a few of them, but they have to be listed for information. xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere.........please stop panicking!

Posts.Content: Hi, I had 4 lots of Doxetacil (T) & Cylophsphamide I had the flu like symptoms but no aches and pains, did feel tired which got worse with each one the only other real side effect was the horrible mouth and lack of taste buds. I had no other real side effects other than the runs after the first one.  It 5 months since my last one and I'm feeling back to normal with no lasting side effects. Good luck, hope all goes well xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere.........please stop panicking!

Posts.Content: Hi, I had my 3rd lot in February, not had any SEs at all. xx
Posts.Title: Zoledronic Acid

Posts.Content: I am doing really well used the cold cap, my hair did thin it's grown back thicker than before. I don't seem to have no lasting SEs from the chemo, also no SEs from taking Tamoxifen. I've just had the expander implant replaced with a permanent one. So all is looking good. Chemo is scary but you will get through it should you need it. xx
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi, I had the Oncotype test in Oct 2015, I thinks it's been available in England since mid 2015.  I had 8mm ductal cancer, sentinel node was clear, I wasn't expecting to be having chemo. My score was 38 which gave a 26% risk of recurrence with out chemo, reduced to 8% with chemo. Dreanthief posted a graph a while ago which was very informative. I assume I needed the chemo as my Oestrogen & Progesterone receptors were around the middle of the scale. Although the thought of chemo scared me, I was fortunate to only need 4 cycles and got away with minimal side effects. xx
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi sorry I've worried you, I suspect I had the Oncotype because my oestrogen receptors were in the middle of the scale. Your oncologist will have made their decision on your results.  Although I had chemo I didn't need radiotherapy. Not easy I know try not to worry you treatment will tailored for you. Take care & hugs from me xx
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi, yes it was, I've been asked a few times why I needed chemo when it was only 8mm, sentinel node clear & had a mastectomy, thanks to you I have an answer especially for those who kept saying "you've been over treated".  Happy New Year to the both of you x
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Happy Christmas everyone xxx
Posts.Title: Merry Christmas Everyone :)

Posts.Content: Hi my results changed completely from the biopsy, 44mm DCIS with a suspicion of micro invasion.  Results after OP were 8mm Invasive G3 ER & PR + HER - also 8mm high grade DCIS. Xx
Posts.Title: Post Op results

Posts.Content: Hi, I've had 5, 6 monthly infusions of these to prevent bone mets. Not had any side effects at all. It takes about 20 mins. xx
Posts.Title: Anyone refused to take bisphosphonates?

Posts.Content: Hi have 3 friends who had breast cancer between 10 and 16 years ago they different treatments and are still going strong. At work there is a number of ladies who are also alive and well one it was over 20 years ago.  All positive stories. xx
Posts.Title: Natural v Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I started Tamoxifen 3 weeks after chemo finished. Used the cold cap so didn't loose all my hair but it did thin and continue to shed for a number of weeks after. 10 months later it's growing really well and appears to be thicker than before. All my body hair has also returned as normal. Hope this helps xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen straight after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I had 4 cycles of DC, I used the cold cap so kept about 60% of my hair. While my eyebrows & lashes did thin I never lost them. I only had bone pain once it was on about the 5th day after the 1st cycle. It was a bit like contractions in my lower back, lasted a few hours. I probably lost about a stone & a half over the 4 cycles. Not everyone gets all the SEs, we're all different. xx
Posts.Title: Truth about doxetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi, I've replied to your post on the radiotherapy thread. Please message me anytime. Whereabouts do you live, I'm near Blackpool. Take care
Posts.Title: breast cancer, looking for advice,experiences,support

Posts.Content: Hi I'm not sure there is a difference I might be wrong. I think the process is called scalp cooling, while the apparatus you wear is called the Cold Cap. I used the Paxman System, there is another type were they put the caps in the freezer, and change them periodically during the chemo. Not sure if this helps. x
Posts.Title: Difference between 'cold cap' and 'scalp-cooling'

Posts.Content: Hi, I had my 1st year mammogram on 13 Oct, I only received the result last Sat they took 6 weeks. Also very oddly worded 'no significant abnormalities detected which is reassuring'. I've assumed this means it's ok.  I know it's hard, try not worry xx
Posts.Title: 1st routine mammogram and alandrolic tablet

Posts.Content: Hi Liz Good luck for tomorrow let us know how it goes. My BCN gave me a print out with 2 graphs and details of % risk of recurrence with or with out chemo. I would ask for this if you're not given it, it helps to read through it. ❤️
Posts.Title: Thinking of turning down chemo

Posts.Content: Hi You can find it by Googling NHS Predict. I looked on this before I received my Oncotype results, I think it came out as an extra 3% benefit from chemo. When I received the Oncotype results the benefit from chemo was 17% that's why after a lot of thought I went with the recommendation. Hopefully your score will indicate you may not need chemo, I'll keep my fingers crossed for you.
Posts.Title: Thinking of turning down chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed last year a month after my 60th birthday. I wasn't expecting to need chemo after the biopsy results. My results after surgery were 8mm G3 + 8mm DCIS sentinel node was clear. I had the Oncotype test my score came back at 38 which is the low end of the higher risk. I was very disappointed that chemo was recommended. I had 4 cycles of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide, before the 1st one I was really nervous and scared as I live alone, fortunately for me I didn't get many of the side effects. It's nearly 3 months since my last one, I feel really well. With hindsight having chemo as given me extra reassurance. I'm taking Tamoxifen for 2 years, followed by Leztrole for 3, also having Zoledronic acid infusion every 6 months. Because I had a mastectomy didn't need any radio. You have to do what feels right for you. Hope this helps, take care.
Posts.Title: Thinking of turning down chemo

Posts.Content: Happy anniversary enjoy, have a lovely day xx
Posts.Title: Celebration today ...

Posts.Content: Hi I had 4 lots of Doxetacil, I some bone aches about 4 days after the 1st one it only lasted about 24 hours. I fortunate didn't have any of the numbness or pain in my hands of feet. I did get tired for a few days each cycle which did get worse each time. Lost my appetite & everything tasted horrible, but never had a sore mouth or mouth ulcers. Hope this helps, take care.
Posts.Title: Docetexal

Posts.Content: Hi, On the chemo info, I was advised to use a babies toothbrush & children's toothpaste as they are not as abrasive, and not to use an electric one. They did the job really well probably because the head is so small it gets in all the nooks etc. xx
Posts.Title: Soft head for electric toothbrush, during chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi I had my surgery on 31/10/15, my Oncotype type results took nearly 4 weeks to come through. I started my treatment 4 cycles of TC chemo on 21/12/15 which I think is around 7 weeks. Try not to worry you'll be fine.
Posts.Title: Delay in treatment

Posts.Content: Sarah it's normal to worry I convinced my self that it had spread to my Lymph nodes but they were clear. I doubt if yours is G1 and only small it will spread. Take care
Posts.Title: Help!! Petrified.

Posts.Content: Hi, my biopsy showed 44mm of DCIS with a suspicion of micro invasion. The results after the mastectomy were 8mm of G3 invasive + only 8mm of DCIS. Nothing was found in the sentinel node. They did say at the hospital that once they'd removed the tissue the results may change.
Posts.Title: Help!! Petrified.

Posts.Content: Hi my biopsy results were similar to yours 44mm DCIS with a suspicion of micro invasion. I was advised with that amount of DCIS a mastectomy was recommended. When I received my results after the operation I had 8mm Grade 3 + 8mm DCIS, sentinel node was clear. Mine was Oestrogen + 6 out 8. This was late 2015, I had 4 cycles of chemo, not pleasant but doable. I suspect your wig lady doesn't know what she's talking about, there's the saying which I think is 'little bit of knowledge being dangerous', or something like that. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, is not that you're grade 3 not stage 3? They are different. xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a mastectomy & reconstruction in October found a small 8mm G3 + 8mm DCIS none in node. I had the Oncotype test received a score of 38 and was recommended chemo 4 cycles of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide had the last one yesterday. Will be starting hormone therapy in three weeks. I don't need any radiotherapy.  The treatment is to hopefully help prevent any reacurance in the future.
Posts.Title: Possible chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi, I had chemo last year, it probably will take a few months to build your up your stamina. I used the cold cap probably kept about 60% of my hair. I did start panicking has it kept shedding for about 6 to 8 weeks after the last chemo. It did carry in growing all the time even while shedding. Now a year after my last chemo.it all grown back just looks layered. It's in really good condition and thicker than before chemo, also quite curly. Hope this helps.xx
Posts.Title: Post Chemo Fatigue and Hair!

Posts.Content: Hi, I've had 3 of these next one due mid August, I've had no side effects. My oncologist went through the possible SEs, but he did say most people don't have any. xx
Posts.Title: Bones

Posts.Content: Hi, used the cold cap kept about 60% of my hair. Although it's slowed down it is still shedding 8 weeks later. It is uncomfortable for about the first 15-20 mins. I'm not having radiotherapy I think it's because I had a mastectomy. I couldn't have worked between cycles didn't have the energy. I've been off since had the mastectomy, I'm having the final part of my reconstruction some time next month.
Posts.Title: About to start chemo and so worried

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a mastectomy 30/10 last year, I had 8mm grade 3, I also had the Oncotype (US test) my score was 38 so chemo recommended. I had 4 sessions of Doxetacil & Cylophsphamide, had my last one 22 Feb.  I was very worried before hand about all the side effects thought I would get them all. I was fortunate I didn't get many. The lack of energy/tiredness which gets a worse with each cycle & the horrible mouth, nothing tasted right, lived on scrambled egg, tomato soup and ice lollies for nearly 2 weeks out of each 3 week cycle. Try to drink between 3 to 2 litres of liquid a day this helps. Chemo is not a walk in the park, but it is doable and you get through it. Do you mean you're grade 3 rather than stage 3? Take care
Posts.Title: About to start chemo and so worried

Posts.Content: Hi Zanib good news that your Tumour & Lymph nodes have shrunk. This will be your last round of chemo and side effects, you'll get through this last one as you have the others. Being estrogen positive means you be able to take medication such as Tamoxifen to prevent it coming back.  I had my chemo after surgery so not sure how long you'll have to wait. Hugs xx
Posts.Title: happy after seeing oncologist

Posts.Content: Hi, I had the Oncotype test, I had 8mm grade3 ER positive my test score was 38 so chemo recommended. I'm not an expert but if it's grade 1 your score might well be low. The oncologist is probably just double checking to be on the safe side. I think my results took 3 weeks. Hope this helps, let me know if you need anymore info. xx
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi, you've been in my thoughts today, I hope you are ok. Hugs from me xx
Posts.Title: Thank you to everyone who offered support last night when I really...

Posts.Content: Hi I had 4 lots of Doxetacil last one was 5 weeks ago, I've had no problems with my finger or toe nails up to now. I didn't paint mine as I was told by my BC there not sure it works and it could mask infections. She did say to keep my hands and feet well moisturised. You should find out what chemo you're having from the oncologist, mine went through in detail the side effects and what to expect, I was also given Macmillan fact sheets for both drugs. Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Toes!
